name: Police Woman
overview: Sergeant “Pepper"” Anderson, an undercover cop for the Criminal Conspiracy Unit of the Los Angeles Police Department, poses undercover from mob girl to prostitute.

episodes.name: The End Game
episodes.overview: Pepper and Crowley pose as bank employees to nail a particularly vicious gang of bank robbers.

episodes.name: The Beautiful Die Young
episodes.overview: Pepper and Crowley investigate a modeling school that takes advantage of young runaways girls, turning them into white slaves in Japan, or making them participate in pornographic movies.

episodes.name: Warning: All Wives...
episodes.overview: Pepper and Bill go undercover to catch a rapist/killer who is targeting the wives of patients at a hospital. The first suspect is the amorous parking attendant. However, Pepper is later abducted by the real killer, the nephew of a pair of nurses at the hospital, who kills as a way of getting back at his mother who abandoned him as a child.

episodes.name: Seven Eleven
episodes.overview: Pepper goes undercover and impersonates an airline stewardess who is a link in a complex heroin smuggling chain.

episodes.name: Anatomy of Two Rapes
episodes.overview: In this episode two rapes are investigated.  The first victim is a woman who is raped the day before her daughter is supposed to get married.  The second victim is an alcoholic who was raped and murdered and her body dumped in a vacant lot.  It is later revealed that the first victim made up the story in order to stop the wedding. The second rape is solved when a teenager who was teased by the victim admits to killing her.

episodes.name: It's Only a Game
episodes.overview: Squad veterans question whether their newest member really wants the job or is being pushed into it by his father, a retired detective.

episodes.name: Fish
episodes.overview: Pepper goes undercover in a woman's prison to gain the confidence of a fellow prisoner who has information that could put away a mobster.

episodes.name: Flowers of Evil
episodes.overview:
"Flowers of Evil" is a 1974 episode of the American police procedural television series Police Woman. The episode features Sgt. Suzanne "Pepper" Anderson going undercover at a nursing home to investigate a murder. She uncovers a trio of lesbians who are robbing and murdering their elderly residents. The episode, the 8th of the first season, originally aired on November 8, 1974.

Gay and lesbian organizations protested "Flowers of Evil", which producers said was based on a real case, for its portrayal of the killers as lesbians and for the stereotypical presentation of lesbianism. The episode aired a month after a similarly controversial episode of Marcus Welby, M.D. on ABC garnered national protests. Mindful of that recent controversy, NBC delayed the episode and ordered some changes but they were not enough to allay gay and lesbian concern over network television's negative portrayal of homosexuality. After negotiations, NBC agreed not to rerun the episode.

episodes.name: The Stalking of Joey Marr
episodes.overview: Pepper must transfer the son of a murdered gang chief from Mexico to testify against a killer.

episodes.name: Requiem for Bored Wives
episodes.overview: Bob Crane plays a freewheeling disc jockey who finds his wife murdered in her bed.

episodes.name: Smack
episodes.overview: Pepper goes undercover as a high school teacher to hunt down a group of drug pushers.

episodes.name: The Cradle Robbers
episodes.overview: A search for a missing granddaughter of Sergeant Crowley's old friend leads Pepper to an adoption racket in which children are bought and sold.

episodes.name: Shoefly
episodes.overview: Internal Affairs gives Pepper and Crowley 72 hours to find the cop who switched barrels on a murder weapon before the accused killer got to court.

episodes.name: Target Black
episodes.overview: Pepper serves as bodyguard for a visiting campus speaker who, being black and Marxist, is a magnet for threats from hate groups.

episodes.name: Sidewinder
episodes.overview: Four Korean War vets armed with M-16s and a bazooka prepare to pull off Operation: Sidewinder, a heist of an armored car carrying a multi-million dollar payload. One of the men's penchant for prostitutes puts Pepper in the action undercover.

episodes.name: Blast
episodes.overview: The deaths of a prominent politician and a nightclub dancer in a car explosion send Pepper to work as a go-go dancer for the club's owner, a one-time poor boy with a powerful yen for the finer things in life.

episodes.name: No Place to Hide
episodes.overview: A clue is found linking a series of seemingly random murders: Each victim had testified against the mob and was now enjoying a new life in the Witness Protection Program. Pepper goes undercover as a secretary to uncover the leaker.

episodes.name: Nothing Left to Lose
episodes.overview: Larue Collins a police informer is pursued relentlessly by the mob. The song 'Me and Bobby McGee' is the theme used for this episode, which most describe as the best Police Woman episode.

episodes.name: The Company
episodes.overview: Three gangland killings signal that someone is taking over established vice activities. A gambling operator is feeling the heat, and Pepper is there to help.

episodes.name: Ice
episodes.overview: Posing as a couple of jewel fences, Pepper and Crowley travel to Masiaca, Mexico as part of a complex plan to nab a gang of diamond thieves.

episodes.name: Bloody Nose
episodes.overview: While working undercover as a waitress in a seedy roadside diner connected to a series of truckload heists, Pepper finds herself entangled in the ugly spousal abuse dispute between a young married couple in her apartment complex.

episodes.name: The Loner
episodes.overview: Pepper is strangely fascinated by a ruggedly individualistic ex-cop who works as a bodyguard and is antagonizing both the police and the gangster who's after his client.

episodes.name: Glitter With A Bullet
episodes.overview: While investigating the death of a well-known musician, Pepper becomes involved with a confused young rock star and his ruthless manager. (60 mins)

episodes.name: Don't Feed the Pigeons
episodes.overview: When an old lady is killed for her possessions, Sgt Pepper and the crew find that a group is using ""the oldest trick in the book"" to foil grannies out of their money.

episodes.name: Silence
episodes.overview: When a woman goes missing, her mute sister tries to find her, accusing the missing woman's husband of foul play.

episodes.name: Mother Love
episodes.overview: A young woman who is mentally disturbed kidnaps the child she gave up at birth.

episodes.name: Task Force: Cop Killer (1)
episodes.overview: While training with a motorcycle task force to prove women can be   effective motorcycle cops, Pepper falls for a smooth talker.

episodes.name: Task Force: Cop Killer (2)
episodes.overview: While her new love hovers near death, Pepper sets out to discover   who brutally ran him down.

episodes.name: The Trick Book (1)
episodes.overview: An influential banker informs the police that he is being   blackmailed by Madame Hilary La Salle, operator of a very   classy brothel. Apparently she has been keeping a little   black book - her 'trick book' - containing details of all   her clients.

episodes.name: The Trick Book (2)
episodes.overview: When Madame DeSalle is found murdered, and the 'trick book'   goes missing, Pepper Anderson and Bill Crowley are called in   to investigate.

episodes.name: Incident Near a Black and White
Silky Chamberlain
episodes.overview: Con men relieve Crowley's gullible uncle of his life's savings.

episodes.name: Do You Still Beat Your Wife?
The Human Rights of Tiki Kim
Sixth Sense
episodes.overview: Crowley (Earl Holliman) discovers a woman near death in a car trunk, but the driver--her assailant--is freed on a technicality.
